common: Data are not available regarding use in pregnant females to inform any drug-associated risks

description: In rat and rabbit reproduction studies, varenicline did not produce malformations at clinically relevant doses

common: Data are not available on presence in human milk, effects on breastfed infants, or effects on milk production

In animal studies, varenicline was present in milk of lactating rats; however, owing to species-specific differences in lactation physiology, animal data may not reliably predict drug levels in human milk

Lack of clinical data during lactation precludes a clear determination of the risk to an infant during lactation; however, consider the developmental and health benefits of breastfeeding along with the motherâ€™s clinical need
